page.title: 19The River Wid
page.content: The source of the{Wid}lies somewhere to the north of Blackmore,probably in a triangle formed by Redrose Lane, Spriggs Lane and Fingrith Hall Lane. Here the{landscape}consists of several ponds and springs.Much of the water has been channelled into{ditches}and runs along the Chelmsford Road, from Elkins Green to the{Pond}.The Wid then forms two ponds divided by a road bridge .At the end of this pond a dam regulates the flow southwards.Until recently the Green was subject to flooding and an outflow of{sewage } after heavy rain. For a time the stream forms part of the defensive ditch of the old{Priory}and then flows under Wenlocks Lane to the south a eventually becomes a{tributary}of the Can{.Ecology}along the Wid includes fish,kingfishers,huge dragonflies , small mammals and plant life.
